page.title: 08Stanwell-Local History
page.content:
school and a school house should be built in the village of Stanwell, and free instruction to those children who came to be educated. The school opened in 1624, in the reign of James I.
A few days before the closing ceremony a local group of people called { {'The Rats'}wrecked the classrooms,so the ceremony had to be put off for a while. The school finally closed on the 30th of July 1954.
The school was transferred to the County Council in 1938 and the money that had previously financed the school was put into a trust fund that is still administered to the present day for the children of Stanwell.
By Children from Town Farm Middle Sch
